intro: Ditaxis neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
